programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Birmingham won the inaugural UFL championship last year, beating San Antonio in the title game, 25-0, behind season MVP Adrian Martinez; DC finished third in the XFL Conference last season at 4-6, missing the playoffs by three games.

programme.title: Top Rank Boxing on ESPN
programme.desc: Mikaela Mayer (20-2-0, 5 KOs) defends her WBO World welterweight title for the first time against Sandy Ryan (7-2-1, 3 KOs), who she defeated for the title back on Sept. 27 via majority decision at Madison Square Garden in New York.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Coverage of professional baseball.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: A preview of the upcoming Major League Baseball game with expert analysis, insightful observations and exclusive interviews; coverage includes highlights of Major League Baseball games and the latest baseball news with knowledgeable commentary.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Michigan finished second in the USFL Conference last season at 7-3, including a 35-18 road win over the Showboats on April 28 behind Wes Hills; Memphis beat Houston to end the 2024 season, 19-12, to stop an eight-game losing skid and finish 2-8.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Kansas State (28-7) beat Kentucky, 80-79, in OT to advance behind Temira Poindexter; USC (30-3) makes its second-straight Sweet 16 appearance but will be without JuJu Watkins, who tore her ACL in the 96-59 win over Mississippi State.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: Boston has a seven-game losing streak following a 6-2 loss at Anaheim, but the Bruins have won their last three meetings with the Red Wings, including a 3-2 OT victory on Dec. 3; Detroit has lost four of its last five games and is 18-16-3 at home.

programme.desc: UCLA, USC, defending champion South Carolina and Texas are the No. 1 seeds in their respective regional brackets, as 68 teams battle it out in the single-elimination tournament to crown a national champion in women's college basketball.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: LSU claimed a 2-1 advantage against South Carolina in their last series from the 2023 season, winning the finale on March 13 with a 5-1 scoreline; Raeleen Gutierrez posted a game-leading 3 RBIs for the Tigers in the regular season win.

programme.title: SC Featured
programme.desc: Mike Legg scored a goal for the Michigan Wolverines during the 1996 NCAA Hockey Tournament that started a revolution in the sport, as players, both amateur and professional, took the ice looking to replicate the lacrosse-style goal.

programme.title: College Hockey
programme.desc: Complete coverage of matchups between collegiate hockey programs from across the nation.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: Georgia claimed victories over Alabama in their first two meetings of their lone series of the 2024 season before suffering a 5-4 defeat in the finale on March 17, 2024; Emma Bradfoot posted a pair of RBIs for the Crimson Tide in the win on the road.

programme.title: College Hockey
programme.desc: Complete coverage of matchups between collegiate hockey programs from across the nation.

programme.title: The Fight Life
programme.desc: Teofimo Lopez has his eyes set on reigning WBO junior welterweight world champion Josh Taylor, but after several subpar bouts, including dropping his lightweight title, Lopez feels he has a lot to prove he is still a champion boxer.

programme.title: League One Volleyball
programme.desc: Austin and Madison split wins in their first two meetings of the 2025 season with Madison claiming a 3-0 victory in the most recent matchup on March 1; Lauren Carlini posted 40 assists in the sweep at home while Annie Drews Schumacher added 17 kills.

programme.title: UFC Fight Night
programme.desc: Brandon Moreno (22-8-2) goes up against Steve Erceg (12-3-0) in the flyweight main event; Manuel Torres (15-3) faces Drew Dober (27-14) in the lightweight co-main event; Kelvin Gastelum (19-9) goes up against Joe Pyfer (13-3) in a middleweight bout.

programme.title: Cheerleading & Dance Competitions
programme.desc: Performances are judged based on the difficulty of the routine, the demonstration of excellent precision and form in their technique, use of new, unique and innovative choreography in transitions and the overall creativity throughout the routine.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: In 1978, the Celtics drafted Larry Bird, but he played his final year at Indiana State before signing; Los Angeles selected Magic Johnson No. 1 in 1979 after he led Michigan State to a victory over Bird and the Sycamores in the NCAA title game.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The Lakers and Celtics met in the NBA Finals for the first time in 1959, and in the 1960s the two franchises battled for the title six times; Bill Russell was a dominant figure for the Celtics, and Los Angeles featured Jerry West and Elgin Baylor.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The Lakers beat Philadelphia in the NBA Finals in 1980, 1982 and 1983, while Boston won the crown by beating Houston in 1981; Los Angeles and Boston staged the first of three epic battles in 1984, and the rivalry transformed fans' view of the game.

programme.title: Numbers on the Board
programme.desc: Four friends talk all things NBA basketball and provide their unique perspectives, breaking down results from the recent games, the latest news making headlines across the league and rumors making the rounds that could create waves.

programme.title: ESPN Films
programme.desc: The Los Angeles Dodgers and New York Yankees meet in the World Series in back-to-back years in 1977 and 1978, creating a cross-country rivalry featuring unique storylines throughout both dugouts and memorable moments in each series.

programme.title: E:60
programme.desc: On June 2, 2010, Detroit Tigers pitcher Armando Galarraga was one out away from the first perfect game in franchise history, but a wrong call by umpire Jim Joyce would spoil that opportunity and cause backlash on a worldwide scale.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: In the summer of 1998, the St. Louis Cardinals' Mark McGwire and the Chicago Cubs' Sammy Sosa embarked on a chase of one of Major League Baseball's most hallowed records, igniting the passion and imagination of fans and non-fans everywhere.

programme.title: The Point
programme.desc: Analysts cover the latest around the world of the NHL, featuring highlights from recent games, previews of upcoming marquee matchups, the newest stories making headlines and all-access footage to give viewers a unique look at their favorite players.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: San Antonio missed winning the XFL Conference last season via a tiebreaker after going 7-3, including a 25-16 road win over the Renegades on April 27 behind John Lovett; Arlington won its last two games of the 2024 campaign but finished 3-7.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: New York Mets' Griffin Canning went 6-13 with a 5.19 ERA and 130 strikeouts over 171.2 innings in 32 appearances, including 31 starts last season; Houston's Yordan Alvarez has hit 30-plus home runs in each of the past four seasons.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Spencer Schwellenback was 8-7 with a 3.35 ERA as a rookie with Atlanta last season; Randy Vasquez was 4-7 with a 4.87 ERA in 20 starts for San Diego last year.

programme.title: Pickleball
programme.desc: Players take to the Championship Court to compete in the semifinals in men's and women's doubles, mixed doubles, and men's and women's singles on the fourth day of the tournament; Anna Leigh Waters and Ben Johns headline the field.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Kyle Larson secured his first Cup Series win of the season with his victory at Homestead over Alex Bowman, while William Byron holds onto his points lead; William Byron averaged 76.096 mph en route to his win last year over Larson.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Dean Kremer was 8-10 with a 4.10 ERA in 24 starts for the Orioles last season; Max Scherzer signed with Toronto as a free agent in February and has 216 career victories.

programme.title: NHRA Qualifying
programme.desc: The top drag racers in the country attempt to make the show through qualifying times in Top Fuel, Funny Car, Pro Stock and other classifications; the drivers who qualify with the fastest times advance to the elimination rounds.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The third major tournament of the 2025 season features 15 games of qualifying over three days with the top 63 players plus the defending champion competing in the double-elimination match-play bracket; DeeRonn Booker is the defending champion.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: Shawn Langdon leads Antron Brown in Top Fuel by 40 points, Paul Lee leads Jack Beckman in Funny Car by two points and Greg Anderson leads Dallas Glenn in Pro Stock by seven points after Phoenix, the second event of the 2025 season.

programme.title: NHRA Qualifying
programme.desc: The top drag racers in the country attempt to make the show through qualifying times in Top Fuel, Funny Car, Pro Stock and other classifications; the drivers who qualify with the fastest times advance to the elimination rounds.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Day
programme.desc: RaceDay previews the Cook Out 400 and Kyle Larson, who secured his first win of the season with a victory at Homestead over Alex Bowman, going over the latest news from pit road and updated track conditions, along with their predictions.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Kyle Larson secured his first Cup Series win of the season with his victory at Homestead over Alex Bowman, while William Byron holds onto his points lead; William Byron averaged 76.096 mph en route to his win last year over Larson.

programme.desc: Shawn Langdon leads Antron Brown in Top Fuel by 40 points, Paul Lee leads Jack Beckman in Funny Car by two points and Greg Anderson leads Dallas Glenn in Pro Stock by seven points after Phoenix, the second event of the 2025 season.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: DeeRonn Booker of Albuquerque, N.M. captured his maiden PBA Tour title and became just the third African Ameran to win a major tournament with his victory in last year's edition held at Suncoast Bowling Center in Las Vegas.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
programme.desc: George Washington (21-12) makes its first postseason appearance since 2017; Boise State (24-10) fell to Colorado State in the Mountain West Tournament championship game, but is led by All-Mountain West First Team member Tyson Degenhart.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
programme.desc: Utah (16-16) is one of five teams from the Big 12 competing in the inaugural tournament behind Gabe Madsen, who led the team with 15.1 ppg; Butler (14-19) is one of four teams from the Big East in the field behind Jahmyl Telfort and Pierre Brooks II.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Six-time MotoGP champion Marc Marquez continued his strong start with a dominant victory at Argentina to increase his lead over his brother, Alex Marquez to 16 points; Maverick Vinales won the grand prix race last year over Pedro Acosta.

programme.desc: George Washington (21-12) makes its first postseason appearance since 2017; Boise State (24-10) fell to Colorado State in the Mountain West Tournament championship game, but is led by All-Mountain West First Team member Tyson Degenhart.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
programme.desc: Utah (16-16) is one of five teams from the Big 12 competing in the inaugural tournament behind Gabe Madsen, who led the team with 15.1 ppg; Butler (14-19) is one of four teams from the Big East in the field behind Jahmyl Telfort and Pierre Brooks II.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Kyle Larson secured his first Cup Series win of the season with his victory at Homestead over Alex Bowman, while William Byron holds onto his points lead; William Byron averaged 76.096 mph en route to his win last year over Larson.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Six-time MotoGP champion Marc Marquez continued his strong start with a dominant victory at Argentina to increase his lead over his brother, Alex Marquez to 16 points; Maverick Vinales won the grand prix race last year over Pedro Acosta.

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
programme.desc: Georgetown (17-15) is one of four Big East representatives in the inaugural tournament, led by All-Big East First Team member Micah Peavy; Washington State (19-14) makes its second-straight postseason appearance, first under new coach David Riley.

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
programme.desc: Nebraska (17-14) look to rebound following a five-game skid behind All-Big Ten First Team member Brice Williams; Arizona State (13-19) will look to put an end to its five-game losing streak, facing the Cornhuskers for the first time since 2008.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Six-time MotoGP champion Marc Marquez continued his strong start with a dominant victory at Argentina to increase his lead over his brother, Alex Marquez to 16 points; Maverick Vinales won the sprint race last year over Marc Marquez.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: DeeRonn Booker of Albuquerque, N.M. captured his maiden PBA Tour title and became just the third African Ameran to win a major tournament with his victory in last year's edition held at Suncoast Bowling Center in Las Vegas.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: Shawn Langdon leads Antron Brown in Top Fuel by 40 points, Paul Lee leads Jack Beckman in Funny Car by two points and Greg Anderson leads Dallas Glenn in Pro Stock by seven points after Phoenix, the second event of the 2025 season.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The third major tournament of the 2025 season features 15 games of qualifying over three days with the top 63 players plus the defending champion competing in the double-elimination match-play bracket; DeeRonn Booker is the defending champion.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Six-time MotoGP champion Marc Marquez continued his strong start with a dominant victory at Argentina to increase his lead over his brother, Alex Marquez to 16 points; Maverick Vinales won the sprint race last year over Marc Marquez.

programme.title: AMSOIL Championship Snocross Series
programme.desc: The top competitors from around the world compete in the AMSOIL Championship Snocross Series, the premier snowmobile racing event in North America, featuring racers competing on a track with big jumps, highlights of top moments and interviews.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: St. Louis went 7-3 last season to win the XFL Conference, including a 22-8 win over the Roughnecks on May 4 behind 134 receiving yards and two touchdowns from Hakeem Butler; Houston dropped its last six games to finish the 2024 season at 1-9.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: St. Louis went 7-3 last season to win the XFL Conference, including a 22-8 win over the Roughnecks on May 4 behind 134 receiving yards and two touchdowns from Hakeem Butler; Houston dropped its last six games to finish the 2024 season at 1-9.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Kyle Larson secured his fourth Truck Series win of his career with his victory at Homestead over Layne Riggs; Christian Eckes won both races at Martinsville last year, defeating Ty Majeski by .644 seconds and Ben Rhodes by 1.191 seconds.

programme.title: America's Day at the Races
programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.title: The American Rodeo
programme.desc: The top 5 contenders from each region will advance to compete at The American Contender Finals at Globe Life Field in Arlington, Texas.

programme.title: Mexican Liga MX Soccer
programme.desc: Juárez claimed victories over Puebla in their last two consecutive meetings, winning the most recent matchup on Sept. 27 with a 3-2 scoreline; Jairo Torres, Jose Garcia and Óscar Estupiñán found the net for Juárez in the win away from home.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: Creighton claimed a 2-0 sweep over Conncecticut in the 2024 Big East Tournament semi-finals round on May 10, winning game 2 with a 10-6 scoreline; Alyssa Gappa posted a game-leading 6 RBIs for the Bluejays in the postseason win at home.

programme.title: The American Rodeo
programme.desc: The American Contender Tournament offers qualifying rounds across eight rodeo disciplines: Tie-Down Roping, Steer Wrestling, Saddle Bronc Riding, Bareback Riding, Barrel Racing, Break Away Roping, Team Roping and Bull Riding.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: San Antonio missed winning the XFL Conference last season via a tiebreaker after going 7-3, including a 25-16 road win over the Renegades on April 27 behind John Lovett; Arlington won its last two games of the 2024 campaign but finished 3-7.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: San Antonio missed winning the XFL Conference last season via a tiebreaker after going 7-3, including a 25-16 road win over the Renegades on April 27 behind John Lovett; Arlington won its last two games of the 2024 campaign but finished 3-7.

programme.title: 2025 Concacaf Women's U-17 Qualifiers
programme.desc: The four highest-seeded teams from the region (United States, Mexico, Canada and Haiti) awaited 22 teams competing in the first round for the final eight spots; the US has won the competition six times while Mexico has the most runner-ups with five.

programme.title: NHRA Qualifying
programme.desc: The top drag racers in the country attempt to make the show through qualifying times in Top Fuel, Funny Car, Pro Stock and other classifications; the drivers who qualify with the fastest times advance to the elimination rounds.

programme.title: Pro Volleyball Federation
programme.desc: Vegas claimed a 3-0 victory over San Diego in their first meeting of the season on Feb. 7, led by 16 kills and 3 blocks from Hannah Maddux; Alisha Glass Childress added 34 assists and 17 digs for the Thrill in the win away from home.

programme.title: European Poker Tour

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: NHRA Sportsman Series
programme.desc: The top drag racing teams in the country compete in different classifications; drivers accumulate points based on the results of each event and at the end of the season a champion is crowned in the various drag-racing classes.
